question: Why is the annual renewal of Alliance user accounts necessary?
answer: Annual renewal is essential to collect up-to-date information required by granting agencies and to deactivate accounts that are no longer in use.

question: By what date must Alliance users renew their accounts?
answer: All Alliance users must renew their account by June 10, 2025.

question: What happens if an Alliance account is not renewed by the deadline?
answer: If you do not renew it, your account will be automatically deactivated after that date. This means that you will not be able to access your data, but it will not be deleted immediately.

question: Can a deactivated Alliance account be renewed?
answer: Yes, you can renew your account at any time after it has been deactivated.

question: Do recent Alliance account holders need to renew their accounts?
answer: No, if you created your account after January 1, 2025, you DO NOT have to renew it at this time. However, you still have to accept new policies and consents, which will prompt on CCDB.

question: Where can I find the Privacy Policy and other agreements I've accepted for my Alliance account?
answer: All agreements you are required to accept or indicate your preference must be accepted on CCDB. Once signed, you can see them on the page. The policies are also available on the Alliance website (https://alliancecan.ca/en/policies).

question: What types of agreements are users required to accept or indicate preference for on CCDB?
answer: This includes Policies, Standards, Terms, and Procedures; Consent to Access User Data; Optional transfer of file ownership on account deactivation; and Consent to receive optional news and communications from the Digital Research Alliance of Canada.

question: What defines a primary role in an Alliance account?
answer: Your primary role must correspond to your main position, generally the one you will hold for the longest, such as a full-time faculty appointment or the role with your primary supervisor if you are a student or researcher.

question: What is the consequence of not renewing your primary role during the annual renewal period?
answer: If you do not renew your primary role during the annual renewal period, your account will be deactivated.

question: Why are primary roles important for Alliance accounts?
answer: Primary roles are important because they help manage accounts with multiple roles, facilitate communication with users, and assist with reporting.

question: Can a user change their primary role on CCDB?
answer: Yes, users with multiple active roles can change their primary role at any time on CCDB's 'Home' page by clicking the 'Make this role primary' checkbox next to the desired role.

question: What should I do if my professional or academic situation has changed (e.g., new faculty position, moved from Master's to PhD)?
answer: If your role has changed, you must apply for a new role by logging into CCDB and going to 'My Account' → 'Apply for a new role'.

question: How do I manage multiple new role applications for my Alliance account?
answer: If you need several roles, request one role at a time. Any new role approved is set as your primary role by default, but you can uncheck the 'Make this role primary?' box if you don't wish for it to be.

question: How can I disable old roles in my Alliance account if I have a new one?
answer: If your current role(s) is no longer needed, click on 'disable old roles'. This will leave your new role as the primary one and deactivate any other role you have.

question: Who should I contact for support with accessing the Canadian Common CV (CCV) website (https://ccv-cvc.ca/)?
answer: For forgotten usernames, passwords, or technical support for the CCV website, contact the CCV helpdesk directly by email (support@cihr-irsc.gc.ca) or by phone (613-954-1968 or 1-888-603-4178).

question: Who should I contact if I have questions about the Alliance CCV template or issues submitting my CCV on the CCDB?
answer: You should contact support@tech.alliancecan.ca by email.

question: What kind of CCV support does the Alliance Federation provide?
answer: The Alliance Federation provides support ONLY for users that need to submit a CCV to renew an Alliance account or apply for RAC. If you are not an Alliance user, you should contact the agency to which you are trying to submit a CCV.

question: My Alliance account has expired, but I still need access to my data to move it off the Alliance Federation clusters. What should I do?
answer: Please send an email to support@tech.alliancecan.ca so that we can assist you with your request.

question: Who should I contact if my account renewal question is not answered in the FAQ?
answer: Please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca for assistance.

question: What happens if a faculty member with sponsored users does not renew their Alliance account by the deadline?
answer: If a faculty member allows their account to expire, their account as well as the account of all their sponsored users will be deactivated. Any jobs submitted by them or their sponsored users will be paused, and their research group will lose access to files until the sponsor account is reactivated.

question: How can a faculty member (PI) renew their Alliance account?
answer: They will receive an email during the renewal period with a link to the CCDB form. They must update contact information and their CCV (if applicable), fill out a User Satisfaction Survey, update the status of sponsored roles, and then click the 'REQUEST ACCOUNT RENEWAL' button.

question: What are the requirements for university faculty members when renewing their Alliance accounts?
answer: All university faculty, including adjunct faculty, are required to submit a Canadian Common CV (CCV) or update an existing one and report publications enabled by Alliance Federation resources to renew their accounts.

question: Are there any exemptions for faculty members from the CCV submission requirement during Alliance account renewal?
answer: Yes, emeritus and retired faculty, as well as Librarians and Non-academic PIs, are exempted from this requirement.

question: What additional step must university faculty who sponsor other users take during Alliance account renewal?
answer: They will also be asked to update the status of these sponsored accounts (i.e., whether they are continuing or their work is done and the sponsorship has ended).

question: Is it mandatory for all faculty members to update their Canadian Common CV (CCV) to renew an Alliance account?
answer: No, uploading a new CCV is only required for users with Faculty and Adjunct Faculty roles at Canadian academic institutions. It is optional for retired faculty, Emeritus professors, and Librarians.

question: What should retired faculty, Emeritus professors, or Librarians do if they choose not to submit a CCV for Alliance account renewal?
answer: They should send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: If a Principal Investigator (PI) with a faculty role moves to a different institution, will their sponsored users automatically transfer to their new role?
answer: No. Any user the PI wants to sponsor with their new faculty role will have to apply for a new role sponsored by that new faculty position.

question: What happens to sponsored users' access to a Resource Allocation Project (RAP) if their PI's old faculty role is no longer active?
answer: Users sponsored with the old role will lose access to the Resource Allocation Project (RAP) where resources are allocated. Once sponsored users get their new roles activated, the PI will have to add them to their RAP.

question: How can a PI add or remove members from their Resource Allocation Project (RAP)?
answer: They can add to and remove RAP members by going to 'My Projects' → 'Manage Project Membership'.

question: If I uploaded a CCV for a Resource Allocation Competition (RAC) application in the fall, do I need to upload a new one to renew my Alliance account?
answer: No, if you have updated your CCV for your RAC application in the fall, uploading a new CCV for account renewal is optional. However, if you haven't uploaded a new CCV since the last renewal, you will need to upload one.

question: If I have an updated CCV on file and choose to upload a new one during account renewal, what specific publications do I need to mark?
answer: You will only have to mark any new publication enabled by the use of the Alliance Federation resources, not all publications on your CCV.

question: Can a PI access the files of a sponsored user who has moved on and is no longer under their sponsorship?
answer: Consent from that user may be required. It is important to make arrangements with your sponsored user as soon as possible to mitigate the risk of a former sponsored user becoming incommunicado.

question: How do sponsored users (e.g., Doctoral, Masters, External Collaborator) renew their Alliance account?
answer: They will receive an email during the renewal period with a link to the account renewal form. They must update contact information, complete the form, fill out a User Satisfaction Survey, and then click the 'REQUEST ACCOUNT RENEWAL' button.

question: What if my sponsor has indicated that I have moved on or changed positions, affecting my sponsored role renewal?
answer: You will not be able to renew that particular role. Instead, you must apply for a new role that reflects your actual circumstances (e.g., new sponsor, institution, position).

question: My sponsored role is still deactivated after I completed my account renewal on CCDB. What should I do?
answer: Your role is likely still deactivated because your sponsor has not yet renewed or reactivated their account. Your role should activate once your sponsor renews their account and confirms your role.

question: Who should I contact if my sponsored role remains deactivated after I've renewed and my sponsor has confirmed my role?
answer: If you have any questions or need help, please email renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca.

question: What should I do if I made a mistake and renewed my Alliance account with the wrong role?
answer: You should create a new role with your current information. Log into CCDB, go to 'My Account' → 'Apply for a new role', and follow the instructions to select your new role. Your old role will automatically expire if not renewed.

question: If I apply for a new role to correct a mistake, how is my sponsor involved?
answer: Your sponsor will receive an email with a link to a page where they can confirm this new role.

question: What should I do if I'm trying to reactivate an old sponsored role but my sponsor cannot confirm it?
answer: Please send an email to renewals@tech.alliancecan.ca so that we can assist you with your request.
